nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -365,17 +388,21 @@ azure.cosmos.secondary.populateQueryMetrics=if-populate-query-metrics
 ```
 
 ### Define Entities and Repositories
-The [Entity](https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-java/tree/master/sdk/cosmos/azure-spring-data-cosmos#create-repositories) definition is same as above.
+The [Entity](https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-java/tree/master/sdk/cosmos/azure-spring-data-cosmos#define-an-entity)  and [Repository](https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-java/tree/master/sdk/cosmos/azure-spring-data-cosmos#create-repositories) definition is similar as above.
 You can put different database entities into different packages.
 
 ### Setup configuration
 The `@EnableReactiveCosmosRepositories` or `@EnableCosmosRepositories` support user-define the cosmos template, use `reactiveCosmosTemplateRef` or `cosmosTemplateRef` to config the name of the `ReactiveCosmosTemplate` or `CosmosTemplate` bean to be used with the repositories detected.
-<!-- embedme src/samples/java/com/azure/cosmos/multidatasource/DatabaseConfiguration.java#L25-L76 -->
+If you have multiple cosmos database accounts, you can define multiple `CosmosAsyncClient`. If the single cosmos account has multiple databases, you can use the same `CosmosAsyncClient` to init the cosmos template.

nodes.bodyText: Thanks for getting rid of this 👍

I guess I missed this when rebranding, but we should rename this API to -> cosmosFactory()
We don't want cosmosDB
We can make these two instance variables final

We can keep these three instance variables and populate them in the constructor instead of getting them from CosmosFactory and CosmosConfig - that way, throughout CosmosTemplate we can just use these instance variables and not get them every time using the APIs.

Same here, please keep the variables, and populate them in the constructor.
Also, I missed it in my earlier PR, but can you please rename isPopulateQueryMetrics -> enableQueryMetrics
I delete these variables in ReactiveCosmosTemplate, we can get these variables from CosmosConfig variable directly.

I delete these variables before because I think these variables can be got from CosmosConfig or CosmosFactory, so there is no need to define the variables again, it's more clear. and JVM won't affect a lot of performance. But I think your consider is good, I'm not very familiar with it before. Now I bring back these variables
There is also one more place where this is used -> AppConfiguration.java - please update that one as well.
